Class BufferStructure

  • java.lang.Object
    • BufferStructure
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BufferStructureInterface
    public class BufferStructure
extends java.lang.Object
implements BufferStructureInterface
    Structure holding a list of Es, now in a new and improved Linked List format!
    Version:
    2/20/2022
    Author:
    Peter Fabens

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • cursorString

        public java.lang.String cursorString()
        Returns the line with the cursor position indicated. For gap buffer, this means the array with empty spaces as '-'. For linked list buffer, cursor is indicated by a specified character.

      • toStringStruct

        public java.lang.String toStringStruct()
        Prints out the entire structure, with lines separated with newlines.

      • load_line_at_start

        public void load_line_at_start​(java.lang.String str_value)
        Creates a new line at the top of the structure and fills it with the desired data. Assumption: Cursor should move with the line it was previously on.
        Specified by:
        load_line_at_start in interface BufferStructureInterface
        Parameters:
        str_value - String to pass and store to buffer

      • load_line_at_end

        public void load_line_at_end​(java.lang.String str_value)
        Creates a new line at the bottom of the structure and loads the desired data to it. Assumption: Cursor should stay put.
        Specified by:
        load_line_at_end in interface BufferStructureInterface
        Parameters:
        str_value - String to pass and store to buffer

      • load_line_at_position

        public void load_line_at_position​(java.lang.String str_value,
                                  int position)
                           throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Loads specified line at specified position. Assumption: Cursor should shift down if lines are loaded above or at it's position.
        Specified by:
        load_line_at_position in interface BufferStructureInterface
        Parameters:
        str_value - String to load in to buffer
        position - index to add the line in at
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • insert_empty_line_above

        public boolean insert_empty_line_above()
        Inserts a line with no characters directly above the current line. Assumption: Cursor should shift down with current line.
        Specified by:
